entry.title: Portrait of a Creole Woman with Madras Tignon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Portrait of a Creole Woman with Madras Tignon (pictured) fetched nearly $1 million at auction despite questions about both its artist and subject?

entry.title: having bracelets thrown at him (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before having bracelets thrown at him in July, Harry Styles had been the target of Skittles, chicken nuggets, kiwi fruit, tampons, feather boas, cowboy hats, pride flags, and Dr. Simi dolls?

entry.title: Carmen García (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Quechua senator Carmen García helped pass reforms to education in Bolivia that incorporated indigenous and traditional knowledge?

entry.title: Incheon Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the rights to build Incheon Station in the Korean Empire were temporarily given to an American company in an attempt to protect it from the Empire of Japan?

entry.title: Mark Fabish (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mark Fabish was recruited to play college football by coach Al Bagnoli and 30 years later succeeded him as head coach of the Columbia Lions?

entry.title: Lego Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the entire development team of Lego Island was fired the day before the game was released?

entry.title: Edgar Jaffé (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Edgar Jaffé died, D. H. Lawrence wrote to his widow to say that he was glad?

entry.title: Greeting Prelude (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Igor Stravinsky called his 1955 orchestral work Greeting Prelude "a kind of singing telegram"?
